description: Join Matt Ponting for a walk around Royal Victoria Dock, to draw local buildings and discover the heritage of the area, and specifically look at how the authorities masterplanned the area in the early 1980s. Sketchbooks and pens supplied.

factsheet.heading: About the tour and guide
paragraphs: Which buildings did they save and why, what was removed, and what happened next. The session will encourage participants to think about they would have planned the area, both in discussion and through sketching.
The session will be interactive with a number of opportunities to draw the docks, and to reflect on the area now and in the past.
Sketchbooks and pens supplied, though participants are welcome to bring their own materials.

Guide: Matt is a local resident and illustrator, who specialises in bright and colourful architectural drawing, focussing on the docks, with a number of public artworks that can be spotted in the docks.

factsheet.heading: Golden Key Academy
paragraphs: This tour is led by a participant of Open City’s Golden Key Academy – a course training up insightful and engaging guides dedicated to explaining London and bringing its many stories to life. It is part of a wider collection of tour events created by Golden Key Academy guides for the Open House Festival celebrating their conclusion of the four month course.
Further info on the Golden Key Academy https://open-city.org.uk/golden-key-academy

factsheet.heading: Tour meeting point:
paragraphs:
Meet on the grass opposite the entrance to the Love Open Water Swimming pontoon
Dock Road
Royal Docks London 
E16 1AH

factsheet.heading: ALL GOLDEN KEY ACADEMY TOURS ARE STILL GOING AHEAD
paragraphs: THIS TOUR IS GOING AHEAD. PLEASE TURN UP OR CANCEL YOUR PLACE IF YOU CAN NO LONGER MAKE IT. (Info added 9/09/22)

location.address: Love Open Water Swimming pontoon Dock Road

name: Sketch and stroll – masterplanning the docks
